message: Hey All! Here is a list of to-do's before we can go live with the site:
(Feel free to reply to help take-on any of these!)
We're in the home stretch folks! It'd be nice to get this done before the next meeting. It might be a nice lightning talk to show how we created this site!

We don't _have_ to have the photos ready before we go live. The contact form is more important. I just committed a few more styles and Matthew finished up the styling for the past events and resources section - thanks Matthew!
https://github.com/pythonkc/pythonkc.com/issues/1 was logged for the contact form
I'm going to take some time this weekend to focus on it. Perhaps if you and/or meirish do as well let me know when and I'll try to be on IRC at the same time.
Think of it as an IRC hackathon
Of course anybody is welcome to join in, I wasn't meaning to be exclusive to Julia & Matt :)
So as simple as the wrap-up to this should be, our "real lives" keep getting in the way :)
as soon as I figure out how my last commit broke part of the styles, we'll be pretty close to a go-live...
Okay, so there we go: http://pythonkc.com/demo
That's pretty close to the original design, with other backend considerations for: 1. emailing when a site-visitor fills out the contact form; & 2. caching meetup data to prevent rate-limit overrun.
Looks ok to me to go live! There are some tweaks + testing to be done, but for Saturdays demo I think it looks ok.
Been a busy day, but here in a short while I'll switch the code over to the real page and push it
